name: Blue Down
description:
Controls Movement

A, D or Arrow Keys to move

Space to jump

Shoot

Mouse Click or LCtrl 

This is my submission for the 98th Mini Jam. I had 2 days to make a roguelike which threw me off guard because that stipulation was announced the day the jam started and I didn't plan for it. The engine I'm using isn't really equipped for making a game in that genre or perhaps I'm just not good at using it. So the game is just a string of premade rooms and the order in which they appear is randomly generated rather than having true procedural generation.

There are 24 unique rooms but you will probably see some repetition because the game will favor a batch of levels it selects at the start for whatever reason.

Story

You play as a blue witch named Mabel who has summoned a horde of blue demons to do her bidding i.e. house chores.  However, the hellish denizens do not like to be bossed around so revolted by stealing the magical gems that Mabel draws her power from before running off. 

It is your job now to delve into the depths of the labyrinth that the demons escaped to and retrieve the gems so that Mabel can restore her full power.

The Music that I used is by Abstraction who you can find the work of here: http://www.abstractionmusic.com/
